    • Method Detail

      • getPositionForView

        public static int getPositionForView(ListViewWrapper<?> listViewWrapper,
                     View view)
        Returns the position within the adapter's dataset for the view, where view is an adapter item or a descendant of an adapter item. Unlike AdapterView.getPositionForView(android.view.View), returned position will reflect the position of the item given view is representing, by subtracting the header views count.
        Parameters:
        listViewWrapper - the IListViewWrapper wrapping the ListView containing the view.
        view - an adapter item or a descendant of an adapter item. This must be visible in given AdapterView at the time of the call.
        Returns:
        the position of the item in the AdapterView represented by given view, or AdapterView.INVALID_POSITION if the view does not correspond to a list item (or it is not visible).

      • getPositionForView

        public static int getPositionForView(AbsListView absListView,
                     View view)
        Returns the position within the adapter's dataset for the view, where view is an adapter item or a descendant of an adapter item. Unlike AdapterView.getPositionForView(android.view.View), returned position will reflect the position of the item given view is representing, by subtracting the header views count.
        Parameters:
        absListView - the ListView containing the view.
        view - an adapter item or a descendant of an adapter item. This must be visible in given AdapterView at the time of the call.
        Returns:
        the position of the item in the AdapterView represented by given view, or AdapterView.INVALID_POSITION if the view does not correspond to a list item (or it is not visible).

      • getViewForPosition

        public static View getViewForPosition(ListViewWrapper<?> listViewWrapper,
                      int position)
        Returns the View that represents the item for given position.
        Parameters:
        listViewWrapper - the ListViewWrapper wrapping the ListView that should be examined
        position - the position for which the View should be returned.
        Returns:
        the View, or null if the position is not currently visible.

      • getViewForPosition

        public static View getViewForPosition(AbsListView absListView,
                      int position)
        Returns the View that represents the item for given position.
        Parameters:
        absListView - the ListView that should be examined
        position - the position for which the View should be returned.
        Returns:
        the View, or null if the position is not currently visible.
